intro: Ischnosiphon lasiocoleus var. sphenophylloides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed clubmoss, is a rare and specialized member of the family Lepidoziaceae. It is characterized by its small, scale-like leaves and a creeping growth habit, often forming dense mats on rocky or shaded soils. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called strobila, which are typically clustered at the base of the stems. It is found in moist, acidic environments, typically in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
